data.title: Does the images directory fail to work w/ archives?
'Skip' is endless working on the controller.
data.body:
In the V6.99.6,

if I press the 'skip' button with the controller, it is endless working, until press the dismiss or enters any screen. It was the same working as 'toggle_skip', but also can not be cancel with re-press the 'skip' button.

data.title: Automatic non 1:1 window size.
data.body: Now that text should always be sharp, we should consider defaulting to a larger window size.

data.title: MoveInterpolate ignores use_old argument
data.body: The constructor of `renpy.display.movetransition.MoveInterpolate` takes an argument named `use_old`, but the value passed for it is ignored: the `use_old` attribute is always initialized to `False`.

data.title: Typo in method name: get_showinh_tags
data.body: `renpy.display.core.SceneLists` has a method `get_showinh_tags`, which should most likely be `get_showing_tags` instead.

data.title: TypeError when getting transform state for At.render() that has ATL transform function with around (and maybe other) statements.
data.body:
I also sometimes get unsupported operation errors with similar setups. There are workaround, but it would be nice to get this to work properly... Original code setup was a LOT longer but I narrowed the error down.

It's not providing the same arguments as statements, I tried changing them to unique names and nothing changed.

``` python

transform vortex_particle(t=10, around=(config.screen_width/2, config.screen_height/2), angle=0, radius=200, circles=3):
    subpixel True
    anchor (0.5, 0.5)
    around around
    angle angle
    radius radius
    linear t radius 0 clockwise circles circles

label start:
    show expression At(Solid("F00", xysize=(20, 20)), vortex_particle())
    pause
    return
```

---

I'm sorry, but an uncaught exception occurred.

Executing ATL code at game/script.rpy:13
  File "game/script.rpy", line 58, in script
    show expression At(Solid("F00", xysize=(20, 20)), vortex_particle())
TypeError: 'Solid' object is not iterable

-- Full Traceback ------------------------------------------------------------

Full traceback:
  File "game/script.rpy", line 58, in script
    show expression At(Solid("F00", xysize=(20, 20)), vortex_particle())
  File "D:\Coding\Dropbox\Dev\RenPy\renpy\ast.py", line 1053, in execute
    show_imspec(self.imspec, atl=getattr(self, "atl", None))
  File "D:\Coding\Dropbox\Dev\RenPy\renpy\ast.py", line 1025, in show_imspec
    atl=atl)
  File "D:\Coding\Dropbox\Dev\RenPy\renpy\exports.py", line 551, in show
    sls.add(layer, img, key, zorder, behind, at_list=at_list, name=name, atl=atl, default_transform=renpy.config.default_transform, transient=transient)
  File "D:\Coding\Dropbox\Dev\RenPy\renpy\display\core.py", line 854, in add
    thing._show()
  File "D:\Coding\Dropbox\Dev\RenPy\renpy\display\motion.py", line 932, in _show
    super(ATLTransform, self)._show()
  File "D:\Coding\Dropbox\Dev\RenPy\renpy\display\motion.py", line 916, in _show
    self.update_state()
  File "D:\Coding\Dropbox\Dev\RenPy\renpy\display\motion.py", line 773, in update_state
    fr = self.function(self, self.st, self.at)
  File "D:\Coding\Dropbox\Dev\RenPy\renpy\atl.py", line 503, in execute
    action, arg, pause = block.execute(trans, timebase, self.atl_state, event)
  File "D:\Coding\Dropbox\Dev\RenPy\renpy\atl.py", line 691, in execute

data.title: What's wrong with zoom?
data.body:
In the Ren'Py 6.99.5.602

I trying to solve the Out of Memory, so I fixed scripts and images. But now, I have a problem with the **zoom**.

**This is my defined code,**

image photos:
        'images/photo.png'
        zoom -.5

**And I called it to screen,**

screen archives:
    modal True
    tag menu
    use arccommon
    hbox xalign .5 yalign .35:
        add 'photos'

The 'zoom' is working, but the image was flip to vertical.

![screenshot0002](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5509466/9243740/4473d5c0-41cf-11e5-8fe8-d57eecfea5f6.png)

data.title: Steam on Ubuntu
data.body:
I have been trying to run several different Ren'Py games in steam in Lubuntu 15.04. Lubuntu is variant of Ubuntu linux os.
Since Ubuntu 15.04 is so new steam tries to use wrong libraries. Steam can be started with following script:
mep@lubu:~$ cat steami
# !/bin/bash

export LD_PRELOAD='/usr/$LIB/libstdc++.so.6'
export DISPLAY=:0
# export LIBGL_DEBUG=verbose

steam
mep@lubu:~$ 
With this work around lot WinterWolves Ren'py games don't work.

From all WinterWolves games that I tried only Loren The Amazon Princess worked. By trying to start game Always Remember Me for example manually while in steam:
mep@lubu:~/.steam/steam/steamapps/common/AlwaysRememberMe$ ./Always\ Remember\ Me.sh 
Illegal instruction (core dumped)
mep@lubu:~/.steam/steam/steamapps/common/AlwaysRememberMe$ 

When steam is closed they work like:
mep@lubu:~/.steam/steam/steamapps/common/AlwaysRememberMe$ ./Always\ Remember\ Me.sh 
[S_API FAIL] SteamAPI_Init() failed; SteamAPI_IsSteamRunning() failed.
[S_API FAIL] SteamAPI_Init() failed; unable to locate a running instance of Steam, or a local steamclient.so.
mep@lubu:~/.steam/steam/steamapps/common/AlwaysRememberMe$ 

But with no steam running there aren't cloudsave&achievements and other steam api using things.

To me it looks like everything that crashes with Illegal instruction (core dumped) don't have steamclient.so. 

So is there someway making those games that crash work?
Some that work from steam are Analogue A Hate Story, Long Live The Queen and Loren The Amazon Princess. Some that doesn't are nearly everything from WinterWolves(Tried ~10+ titles and only one worked) and Shan Gui which needs steam to even start.

data.title: Title Screen "Help" Button fails to launch Help on Windows 10 / IE 11
data.body:
I'm running Windows 10, and it seems that the default behavior (the Help() action) of the title screen does not launch the help file correctly. When I click the button, it launches Internet Explorer, but does not display the help page. It just loads up my homepage.

Details:
- This behavior (Launching IE) is the same regardless of what my default browser is set as.
- My IE version is 11.0.10240.16384
- My Windows 10 Build is 10240
- I upgraded from Win 7 to Win 10, which is why I have IE 11
- My RenPy version is 6.99.5.602

data.title: Ignore multitouch events on Android.
data.body: Make this configurable, but by default, Ren'Py doesn't use them.

data.title: NoTransition not working
data.body:
As per discussion with Tempura in Freenode #renpy 8/1 evening

$ no_trans = NoTransition(3.0)   # raises exception

$ no_trans = renpy.display.transition.NoTransition(3.0)   # does not raise exception, but does not work as a transition or work inside a MultipleTransition

data.title: ToggleMute() doesn't work on creator-defined mixers
TODO list for text oversampling
data.body:
- [x] sfonts need to be supplied the original size and scaled up. (This needs to be done precisely - perhaps store the original and scaled sizes.)
- [x] embedded displayables need to be scaled up.
- [x] outlines must be placed correctly.
- [x] text tag parameters may need to be scaled.
- [x] add a switch to turn off. (And an environment variable to control that switch.)

data.body: So that it can't be deleted or overwritten without being unlocked first.

data.title: Python 2.7.9 Error (assert --> try)
data.body:
http://simpy.readthedocs.org/en/latest/

This took me over 20 hours to track down. The module works flawlessly when installed on real Python 2.7.9. It should do the same in Ren'Py as it has no dependencies Ren'Pys Python does not offer.

However this Error comes up in most tests:

I'm sorry, but an uncaught exception occurred.

While running game code:
  File "game/script.rpy", line 51, in script
    python:
  File "game/script.rpy", line 56, in <module>
    env.run()
RuntimeError: <Release() object at 0x4a5a4d0> has already been triggered

-- Full Traceback ------------------------------------------------------------

Full traceback:
  File "game/script.rpy", line 51, in script
    python:
  File "D:\Coding\Dropbox\Dev\RenPy\renpy\ast.py", line 797, in execute
    renpy.python.py_exec_bytecode(self.code.bytecode, self.hide, store=self.store)
  File "D:\Coding\Dropbox\Dev\RenPy\renpy\python.py", line 1448, in py_exec_bytecode
    exec bytecode in globals, locals
  File "game/script.rpy", line 56, in <module>
    env.run()
  File "D:/Coding/Dropbox/Dev/RenPy/TestBed/game/simpy-3.0.8-py2.7.egg\simpy\core.py", line 137, in run
    self.step()
  File "D:/Coding/Dropbox/Dev/RenPy/TestBed/game/simpy-3.0.8-py2.7.egg\simpy\core.py", line 221, in step
    callback(event)
  File "D:/Coding/Dropbox/Dev/RenPy/TestBed/game/simpy-3.0.8-py2.7.egg\simpy\resources\base.py", line 241, in _trigger_get
    proceed = self._do_get(get_event)
  File "D:/Coding/Dropbox/Dev/RenPy/TestBed/game/simpy-3.0.8-py2.7.egg\simpy\resources\resource.py", line 179, in _do_get
    event.succeed()
  File "D:/Coding/Dropbox/Dev/RenPy/TestBed/game/simpy-3.0.8-py2.7.egg\simpy\events.py", line 131, in succeed
    raise RuntimeError('%s has already been triggered' % self)
RuntimeError: <Release() object at 0x4a5a4d0> has already been triggered

Windows-8-6.2.9200
Ren'Py 6.99.6.611
TestBed 0.0
# 

I've traced it down to:
simpy.resources.base.BaseResource._trigger_put

and

simpy.resources.base.BaseResource._trigger_get

Both have very similar lines:

```
    while idx < len(self.get_queue):
        get_event = self.get_queue[idx]
        proceed = self._do_get(get_event)
        if get_event.triggered:
            assert self.put_queue.pop(idx) == put_event
```

Error disappears and everything works normally if these are changed to:

```
    while idx < len(self.get_queue):
        get_event = self.get_queue[idx]
        proceed = self._do_get(get_event)
        if get_event.triggered:
            try:
                self.get_queue.pop(idx) == get_event
            except:
                pass
```
# 

In this case it is no longer an issue but even if this cannot be fixed easily, at the very least it should be noted somewhere in documentation that such a thing may occur so people would know what to look for.

I replicated it on two computers, moving code to init python did not help either, just started to throw different errors. Problem is not with BoundClass class, I got rid of those then testing. It could be the insane traceback implementation or Ren'Pys parser... otherwise I do not have a clue on why this is happening.
